name: Edon Kelmendi
content: Edon Kelmendi Edon Kelmendi Home CV Publications ↪ by Theme Talks Notes Teaching Edon Kelmendi e.kelmendi@qmul.ac.uk Bio I am a lecturer in computer science at Queen Mary, University of London. I finished my doctorate at Laboratoire Bordelais de Recherche en Informatique under the supervision of Hugo Gimbert. Afterwards, I was a postdoc with Mikołaj Bojańczyk in Warsaw, and later with Joël Ouaknine and James Worrell at Oxford and MPI. Links: DBLP, Google Scholar, arXiv Interests I am generally interested in the theory of computation, particularly in algorithmic verification, and: Dynamical Systems Logics in CS Game theory Automata News 03/2025 Invited talk to SAMSA: Series, Automata, Matrices, Symbolic dynamics, and their Applications in Warsaw 03/2025 Invited talk to the Automata in the Wild Workshop in Warwick 01/2025 I am on the program committee of MFCS 2025. 03/2024 I have a funded PhD studentship. Email me if you are interested. 02/2024 I am on the program committee of FSTTCS 2024. Contact Office CS/433 e.kelmendi@qmul.ac.uk Phone: +44 (0) 759 99 09 09 19 Address School of Electronic Engineering and Computer Science Queen Mary, University of London Peter Landin Building 10 Godward Square London E1 4FZ Page generated 2025-06-06 09:57:18 CEST, by jemdoc+MathJax.
